Name: Abuja
Description: Abuja is the capital of Nigeria. Since most Nigerian government agencies are now headquartered in Abuja and most other countries' embassies have been relocated from Lagos to Abuja, it is a surprisingly expensive city.

Name: Benin City
Description: Benin City is one of the oldest cities in Nigeria, dating back to pre-colonial times.  It boasts one of the most advanced and organised kingdoms before the arrival of the British.  The city used to be the capital of the old Bendel state until this was divided into Edo and Delta. Currently Benin City is the capital of Edo.

Name: Calabar
Description: Calabar is the capital city of Cross River State in Southeast Nigeria. It is a charming and quite peaceful city.

Name: Enugu
Description: Enugu is the capital of Enugu State in Southeast Nigeria.

Name: Ibadan
Description: Ibadan is a city in Southwest Nigeria.

Name: Kano
Description: Kano is a city in Northern Nigeria and the capital of Kano State.

Name: Lagos
Description: Lagos is the most populous city in Nigeria. With an estimated population of 8.8 million inhabitants in the city, or 16 million in the metropolitan area, Lagos ranks second only to Cairo as the most populous city in Africa.

Name: Osogbo
Description: Osogbo (Oshogbo) is a town in Southwest Nigeria.

Name: Port Harcourt
Description: Port Harcourt is a gulf city and capital of Rivers State in Southeast Nigeria and is the centre for the blooming oil industry in the country. Most speak English, but Igbo is the dominant language.

Name: Yankari National Park
Description: Yankari National Park is in Northern Nigeria.

Name: Cross River
Description: Southwest Nigeria is a region of Nigeria.

Name: Lagos
Description: Lagos is the most populous city in Nigeria. With an estimated population of 8.8 million inhabitants in the city, or 16 million in the metropolitan area, Lagos ranks second only to Cairo as the most populous city in Africa.
